Not the same game play as the first Final Fantasy Dimensions. There is no exploring. I ended up playing for the side quests because some are funny. Shops all sell the same items and is hard to make money. I find it strange that the first Final Fantasy Dimensions was my favorite final fantasy game ever played and Final Fantasy Dimensions 2 was the worst!

this game have a good story, and I like it but, I change my phone, and the resolution did not suit my new phone, dear square enix team, please give this game an update for fixing the resolution. I really need this since the picture is cropped in my new phone thank you very much After 1 / 2 years they repair it I so happy

Fantastic game and the recent update finally fixed the screen cutoff issue. So happy to be able to play this game on my phone again!

They finally fixed the screen scaling problem :) I haven't played the game much, but I think the idea of a paid offline version of a gacha game is great. Say what you will about the genre, but it sucks when a game is shut down and disappears from the world.

I've owned this game now for 3 years and they still have not updated the game to fit modern displays. Almost insulting really as they have updated games older than this. Square Enix Mobile team are lazy as hell.

Itd be a five star but i got a new phone n downloaded this game, and the app screen is too big for my phone. Now, it wouldnt be a issue but i cant access my menu or travel to different times so im stuck in the present. Please fix the screen so i can continue to enjoy this amazing game

In a word: unplayable. No, seriously. The aspect ratio of the screen cuts off the entire perimeter of the gameplay and UI, denying you access to necessary buttons and menu functions. In otherwords, it is literally impossible to play this game on your phone. And given that the last update was in 2017, this game is essentially dead content. It should be removed from the Google Play Store and anyone who paid for it should be given a full refund. For shame, Square Enix.
Different, but still amazing. Shame it doesn't fit on most phone screens but is super fun on the tablet!

I can't play it because of the screen ratio. I literally can't see how much HP my top character has and it cut off the auto button as well. I think the menu button is also no longer visible. I remember on my pixel 3 it was bad, but I could still hit the buttons, even though they were about 70-80 percent off off-screen, but this is way worse. I can't even save the game when I want to and I'm at the mercy of the auto save. Are there any plans to fix this or no?

Please, Square Enix, bring FF Legends II back. Everyone would really appreciate it.

It's NOT Dimensions-only-better. Don't expect it to be anything as good as FF Dimensions. It is okay for what it is. It's a port of an online-only game, and it stays true to its roots. I got it to play when I knew I wouldn't have internet connectivity, since that's how the original Dimensions was, but this game required internet access. No reason for that, as far as I can tell. Even beyond that aspect, it's sapped out a lot of the fun of the Final Fantasy enterprise. Any FF game is better.

Not recommended.

I like how the story is the focus of this game even more so than other Final Fantasy games. Yes, exploration is gone, but so are obnoxious random encounters. The battles you fight all have story behind them. While it is unfortunate that a lot of expectations were set and not met by this new format, in it's own right this is a great game. If you want a game in the Final Fantasy universe that is more like playing a story and less like grinding through a JRPG, this game is for you.

I think it's a very good game

I played through the first story arc and really enjoyed the game. As others have said in their reviews, this isn't your typical Final Fantasy game--it plays just like free to play social RPGs, where instead of exploring dungeons you select nodes on a map and fight waves of energies. That said, the annoying stuff about f2p RPGs--gacha systems, stamina--have all been removed from this version. Still, if you don't enjoy those types of games, you won't like this one. But if you're not put off by the design of mobile RPGs, then you'll enjoy FFD2. It can become repetitive, but that's probably not an issue if you're looking for an easy way to spend time with auto battle on.  This game has a lot of content; I spent about 35 hours on the first story arc, and there's plenty more side quests and a second story left to go. The story isn't amazing, but it's enjoyable. It's sometimes nonsensical--one sidequest in a post-apocalyptic future involves confiscating video game systems, but who's even manufacturing them during that time period?--and the world doesn't always feel tight and fleshed out. But I came to enjoy the characters.

Overall it's a good game with a really  entertaining story and characters... but I wouldn't call that «Final Fantasy» as it has nothing the rest of the series has to offer: there's no exploration, no jobs, and no challenge at all. From the very beginning to the end the game takes you by the end and tells you where to go or what to do. Even the magic is completely screwed up: the game lets you easily beat up Shiva with ice spells or Ifrit with fire spells... And graphics could also be a lot better considering the price of the game. Still there's a lot to do, a lot to see and a lot to unlock. Despite all its flaws, I like this game

There's no exploration, no changing of abilities or characters, everything RPG is gone. Just because you repcon the same story and reuse character personalities and increased graphics doesn't mean your game is better. I want a refund as I'm not getting my money's worth.

I'm 20 hrs into the game now and it's still sucky. Save your money and get something else.    All in all, craptacular. The first FFD was a great throwback to the original FF games right from the start, this is nothing like that. Its like a combination of the mobil games FFRK and FFBE but you have to pay for it. Unsurprisingly the story seems good which is usually the case with Final Fantasy but 2 hrs in I rank this well below 1992s Final Fantasy Mystic Quest. We'll see if my opinion changes at the end of the game.

If you're expecting this to be a direct sequel to FFD I'll be the first to say it is not. Which turned me off to this initially. I paid for it though and pushed through and I'm glad I did. About 30 hours into it, I still haven't beaten the main story and there's plenty of stuff to do. The game grows on you, the soundtrack and story are pretty solid.  Autoclave feature on this game is perfect, I play a lot a few minutes at a time here and there and don't always remember to save. So far that's had my back.  If you have the money to spare give it a chance, as long as you don't expect it to be like the first dimensions you'll most likely enjoy yourself.
Does not fit the screen on pixel 2 xl. Blown up and items are cut off on edges

What is this garbage? This is not a final fantasy game. This is a very sad attempt at a generic mobile game. I love final fantasy, but I did not love this. If you salvage this franchise and manage to be able to finance a 3rd installment, go back to the original formula. Dimensions 1 was a great game. Bad call.

I'm not a fan of this direction. The original dimensions was exactly what a final fantasy game was, this feels like the free to play games without IAPs. This doesn't hold my interest at all, and doesn't seem up to the normal standards of a Final Fantasy.

Think of it as FFRK and FFBE combined with no pay2win factors and single payment game. Not my cup of tea and totally regretted buying it for 20 bucks. Going back to replay FFD1 and keeping this as a collection I guess when I get really bored I might play it once a while. Oh yeah and also it's way too easy my cat tapped the battle commands and party didn't perish during a boss fight.

This game improves on some common features in mobile rpgs, such battles happening in waves. There is no exploration, so if that is your favorite part of Final Fantasy, skip this one. The battle system is turn based, and reminds me of Final Fantasy X. The story unfolds in cutscenes, so you don't have to talk to everyone in town to advance the story. Easy to play for a few minutes in between things or for  a few hours.
It is just ok. Not great. Loved the first one but this was nothing like that. Still kind of fun but i think after playing for a day it will lose my attention.

Thank you so much Square Enix for removing the online feature and micro transactions on this global release of FFD2 really appreciate it. I still prefer to pay the game and get the full version and play it without worrying anything. Truly a Mobile RPG on the go! :)

I like the concept or direction of the gameplay. But, oh come on, you only need to clear just 1 battle for 1 dungeon? Man, that's way too short.   The subquests are repetitive and become boring eventually. Even FTP games give more excitement.   Correct me if i'm wrong. But you can't defend? Or skip turn? Sometimes i had to attack at the turn of that lil dragon (i forget the name), while i was intended to build the summon gauge. What a waste of turn.  The story us nice, though. Travelling between time and space. I also like how every character differs with each other, with their own skill list.  At the end, a game with good concept, with some major flaws.

The app doesn't even launch bcz it needs more downloads and then it says download error for no reason. What is the point of putting it out on the market, when it's not ready? Like I thought Square Enix was more prepared than this. Now, I just wasted money on a useless app. Not happy.

Quests become really repetitive really fast, combat is simple and boring and that's all there is to the game, exploration was completely removed in favor of a totally linear map system. I'm very disappointed.

Oh and topping it off the music is really nice to listen to. :D

This game is super disappointing. I really enjoyed Final Fantasy Dimensions 1. It was a solid rpg all around. The story was the weakest point, but the vast length made up for it. Dimensions 2 is a sequel in name only. It was a free-to-play game Square Enix changed to a premium game, except the only difference is no micro transactions have been found. I haven't gotten far, but I did see a video of someone with Tidus in his party. I could see this game trying to sell optional FF classic characters for real money even after the premium.
So far so good. I don't like exploring so this game suits me well. Thanks for fixing the download issue.
Awesome game!!!!

The game is fair. As a long term FF fan, this feels like a simple F2P gacha game with the gacha elements stripped out. It throws a lot of references (boss names/NPC names) but they stop being relevant from there.   It is nowhere near the original FF Dimensions, which I love. Storywise, it has quite a bit of resemblance to the backbone of Chrono Trigger  It's good enough to kill time, though.

Not sure about this one, Feels like a F2P games with select a mission-like system. Really hope its like ordinary final fantasy games where you can just explore the town and dungeon, rather than just select a dungeon to play and you fight some wave of enemies. Story is good, art is nice but the background is too pixelated which is rather weird for me. Overall its a good game...

I like the story as I do with most final fantasy games but Brave Exvius seems to have quite a bit more meat to it in both story and overall game play.  While still a great game I would have been happier to pay for Brave Exvius to remove the freemium aspect of it.
I downloaded the game and it gives me error.... so please refund my mo ey or fix the problem.

As someone who played the original version when it was in Japan and have nearly completed the game's second portion, I can say this game is really worth your time.    Yeah the lack of a world map is a disappointment and the difficulty is kind of lacking, but the game's graphics, music, remake of the esper system, and battle system are really fun. I say if you like a traditional jrpgs like Final Fantasy VI and Chrono Trigger, this game is a really fun game for the mobile phone, even if it is a tad bit cliche.

I love that they revamped a free to play game with all content available for a low price. You hear about people spending hundreds or thousands of dollars trying to get one this-or-that in a gacha game. This one lets you have the whole game and everything in it for just $15.

I'm all for this game, however the game doesn't fit within the screen of my phone. The play area is cropped by the edges of my screen. Portions of character portraits, health meters, and controls are not visible.

Despite the game getting lower than should be score, most are used to this sort of mobile game being free with micro transactions, so to see it as a paid app won't sit well with some people. I'd personally prefer to pay a one time fee for all access to story and gameplay instead of waiting on stamina or paying real money towards a luck based upgrade system.  The soundtrack reminds me a lot of FFXI, same composer I believe, so I get nostalgic when I hear it. It certainly is a FF experience in a modern mobile game format. If you aren't trying to look at it as being a FF title from the 90s, then I'm sure you can find enjoyment from this while you're on the go or you only have a little bit of time to squeeze in some playtime.

Unfortunately for this game, it's the sequel to the fantastic Final Fantasy Dimensions, but in name and concept only. The deep, class-based customization from its predecessor is replaced with character-specific "signet stones," each associated with a special ability, available after fighting a certain number of battles with the stone equipped, and a summon, whose use is tied to a gradually filling gauge. While the storyline, unsurprisingly, promises to at least be interesting enough to play through the game, I can't help but feel this would have been much more reasonably priced at $5 than $15. Wait for it to go on sale.
It's ok but nothing like the first game which makes me sad. The Signet system is Interesting and all the different summon monsters are neat.

It's a mobile stamina and gatcha based game made pay to play with all the f2p stuff taken out. It's good when you look at it through those eyes.
